main event: A witness observed a bright, round object hovering at a high altitude near Milan, Missouri on February 14, 1956.
interesting points: The object emitted a brilliant flash of light which caught the witness's attention., The witness described the object as silvery and larger than a conventional aircraft., The object was observed for several minutes before it accelerated abruptly and disappeared., The object made no noise during the observation., The sighting occurred approximately 3-5 miles from another reported sighting in the area.
sighted object: a round, silvery object in the sky
witness description: William Springett, a civilian driving on State Highway 5
